MS MCQs

    Virtualize memory - One-level page mapping

    »

    1. In traditional virtual memories, each process is provided with:

      A virtual address space with a page table.

      A physical address space without a page table.

      A physical address space with a page table.

      A virtual address space without a page table.


    2. Assume a system has a 64-KB virtual address space, 32 KB of physical memory, and a page size of 4 KB. If the virtual and physical pages are of the same size, how many virtual and physical pages will such a system contain?

      64 and 12 virtual and physical pages, respectively

      12 and 64 virtual and physical pages, respectively

      8 and 16 virtual and physical pages, respectively

      16 and 8 virtual and physical pages, respectively


    3. One-level page mapping as employed by traditional OSs entails:

      Real-to-physical address translation

      Virtual-to-real and then real-to-physical address translations

      Virtual-to-physical address translation

      Physical-to-virtual address translation
